byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad, Ben Hubbard, Eric Schmitt, Mark Landler, Michael S. Schmidt and Ceylan Yeginsu.
byline.original: By RAVI SOMAIYA, C. J. CHIVERS and KARAM SHOUMALI

abstract: NBC News posts statement on its website in which it revises account of kidnapping of chief foreign correspondent Richard Engel in 2012, which it has previously attributed to forces loyal to Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad; statement claims that after review, it is likely that kidnappers were Sunni, not Shia, militant group.
lead_paragraph: NBC News amended its report of the 2012 abduction in Syria of Richard Engel, its chief foreign correspondent, saying Sunni militants were most likely to blame, not forces loyal to the Syrian president.

headline.main: NBC News Alters Account of Correspondent’s Kidnapping in Syria
headline.print_headline: NBC News Alters Account of Kidnapping

snippet: NBC News amended its report of the 2012 abduction in Syria of Richard Engel, its chief foreign correspondent, saying Sunni militants were most likely to blame, not forces loyal to the Syrian president.
